mars module¶

class mars.Grid(m: int, n: int)¶

Bases: object

The Grid class will contain all the information of the plateau where Rovers can move. This will be used to check if Rovers is inside the grid or not.

get_grid() → numpy.array¶

This function returns the grid as an object of numpy array

Returns:

grid

Return type:

numpy array object

property shape¶

This property method returns a tuple of the shape of the grid m X n

Returns:

dimensions of the grid

Return type:

tuple

class mars.Obstacles¶

Bases: object

This class is the responsible for creating new obstacles inside the grid and checking if a certain vector position (X,Y) is found inside the grid.

add_custom_obstacle(custom_obstacle_position: tuple)¶

This function is for adding a custom obstacle position and not randomly. This method is mainly for later testing the rovers behavior against obstacles.

Parameters:

custom_obstacle_position (tuple of integers) – This is a tuple of the position coordinates of the custom obstacle

Returns:

It returns the object

Return type:

Obstacles instance

create_obstacles_in_grid(grid, num=1)¶

This method creates random (num) obstacles inside the grid.

Parameters:

  • grid (Grid) – This is the object created for the custom grid

  • num (integer) – This is the number of obstacles created inside the grid

Returns:

Returns the object instanciated

Return type:

Obstacles

get_obstacles_positions() → list¶

This is the getter method for checking the list of obstacle positions.

Returns:

Returns the list of tuples with position coordinates of the obstacles

Return type:

List of tuples of integers (coordinates in the grid)

has(pos: numpy.array) → bool¶

This methodChecks if there is any obstacle in position pos Returns True if there is obstacle else false

Parameters:

pos (numpy array object) – this is the position where we want to know if there is an obstacle or not

Returns:

Returns True if there is an obstacle in that position. Else returns False.

Return type:

bool

class mars.Rovers¶

Bases: object

This is the Rovers class. This class contains all the information about the state and actions that Rovers can carry out. Rovers has two main states, the position where it can be found in a certain moment and the direction it is pointing at. It has a method move that can receive either rotation instructions (L,R) or moving instructions (M). To determine the position and the direction it is facing we will use basic algebra on vectors mathematical objects. By applying matrix rotations we will obtain the direction where it points at. By adding the direction vector to the position vector we will obtain the next position in the grid.

can_move() → bool¶

This method is for knowing if rovers has found any obstacle and cannot move.

Returns:

True if it can move, False if it cannot move anymore

Return type:

bool

property direction¶

This is the property method of rovers direction. It returns N,S,W,E

Returns:

direction where rovers is facing at current moment

Return type:

string

property history¶

This property method returns the historical positions where Rovers has been during its exploration in Mars. This will be later used for drawing the path that it has followed.

Returns:

list of positions

Return type:

list

move(command: str, grid: mars.Grid, obstacles)¶

This is the move method of the Rovers. If the command is move (‘M’). The robot checks if it can move or if there is any obstacle. If there is an obstacle the can_move object attribute is set to False and the Robot stays in the previous positions. However, if it can move it checks if the next position is in the grid or not. If the next position is not on the MxN grid then it wraps around and obtains a positions that exists in the grid. Then. rovers move to the next position. If the command is ‘R’ or ‘L’ means the robot has to rotate. If so, rotation operation on the direction vector is applied and the direction state (N,S,E,W) is updated.

Parameters:

  • command (string) – This is the command: move or rotate. Posible options are M (move), R (rotate right), L (rotate left)

  • grid (Grid) – This is the grid object of the grid created

  • obstacles (Obstacles) – This is an instance of the Obstacles class

property position¶

This property method returns the position of the rovers.

Returns:

tuple of position coordinates

Return type:

tuple

property vector¶

This property method returns the direction pointer. (0,-1) –> points South (S) (0, 1) –> points North (N) (1, 0) –> points East (E) (-1, 0) –> points West (W)

Returns:

Direction Vector (X,Y)

Return type:

numpy array object
